figure_1.title: Figure 1.
figure_1.caption: PRISMA flow diagram of article selection process.

figure_2.title: Figure 2.
figure_2.caption: Number of publications that include the BES instrument over time.

figure_3.title: Figure 3.
figure_3.caption: Scatterplot of articles published over time.

figure_4.title: Figure 4.
figure_4.caption: Forest plot of the cognitive empathy meta-analysis.

figure_5.title: Figure 5.
figure_5.caption: Forest plot of the affective empathy meta-analysis.

claims.sentence:
Systematic Review
The whole search was carried out following the PRISMA method [36] for systematic reviews (Figure 1).

Results of Syntheses
Regarding the systematic review, it is observed that the use of the BES has been increasing over the years (Figure 2).
Its progression is almost linear (Figure 3), with a linear correlation coefficient of R = 0.889 and a determination coefficient of R2 = 0.791 (p < 0.001; t = 6.45).

Open in a new tab
Number of publications that include the BES instrument over time.Figure 3.
The mean of each Cronbach’s α for all cognitive empathy studies, with their respective confidence intervals, is shown in Figure 4.
The information extracted from the meta-analysis for affective empathy can be observed in Figure 5.

Robust Estimation
For cognitive empathy, the outlier analysis identified 16 studies (1, 4, 6, 7, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 21, 22, 24, 26, 28); for identification, see Figure 4.
For affective empathy, 17 outlier studies were identified (1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 8, 11, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, 26, 29); for identification, see Figure 5.
